data.title: Members - The Trapani Lab at Amherst College
data.snippet:
#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

#### Ha Dong '26

data.title: Sponsored Research and Faculty Development - Amherst College
data.snippet:
## Consistent Navigation

## Main Navigation

## Breadcrumb

# Supporting Students’ Academic Success Sponsored Research and Faculty Development

## Section Navigation

## Sub Navigation

Institutional support for “sponsored research” – essentially that research funded by an extramural agency either through a grant, contract or other mutually agreeable transaction – is quite innovative at Amherst College because it involves close collaboration between Sponsored Research and Foundation and Corporate Relations. [...] This collaborative Website provides links to comprehensive funding opportunity databases, to some of the most commonly sought funding agencies and grant competitions, and also provides advice on proposal writing. The Website also includes a guide to research for undergraduates, and information on College's policies concerning external and internal grant applications.

The Associate Dean of the Faculty, Jack Cheney can also provide constructive comments on draft grant proposals given a reasonable amount of notice, and can offer advice on putting together your project budget.

Amherst College  
Amherst, MA 01002
